questions.question: If you are really interested in her, why don't you ask her ...................... to a movie?
questions.description: To ask somebody out is to invite them on a date.

questions.question: I asked ........................... but nobody had seen my cat.
questions.description: To ask around is to ask the same question to many people.

questions.question: Your bill adds ........................ to 300 dollars.
questions.description: Add up to can mean be equal.

questions.question: I can't get out unless you back ........................ your car.
questions.description: To back up a car is to reverse it.

questions.question: Nobody backed me ................................. when I announced my decision to quit my job.
questions.description: To back somebody up is to support them.

questions.question: The car blew ........................ after it collided with the truck.
questions.description: To blow up is to explode.

questions.question: Ask the children to blow ....................... the balloons for the party.
questions.description: To blow up balloons is to inflate them.

questions.question: The fire fighters had to break ………………….. the building to save the trapped women and children.
questions.description: To break into a building is to enter forcibly.

questions.question: The car broke ........................ in the thunder storm.
questions.description: When a machine or a vehicle breaks down, it stops working.

questions.question: The woman broke .......................... when the police told her that they had strong evidences against her.
questions.description: To break down is to get upset and cry.

questions.question: If the task seems unmanageable break it ......................... into smaller parts.
questions.description: To break it down is to divide it into smaller parts.

questions.question: The thieves broke ...................... at night and stole diamonds and jewels.
questions.description: To break in is to force entry to a building.
